brandcolor-primary.usage: Main CTA button background, primary brand color

brandcolor-primaryhover.usage: Hover state for primary buttons (when background is primary)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with primary background
examples: Full primary button: bg-brand text-brand-bg-white hover:bg-brand-hover
brandcolor-primaryhover.logic: When a button or element has bg-brand, the hover should use bg-brand-hover (darker shade of primary)

brandcolor-secondary.usage: Secondary brand color for outline/secondary buttons with border
examples: Outline button: border-brand-stroke-weak text-brand-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brand-secondary-hover

brandcolor-secondaryhover.usage: Hover state for secondary/outline buttons (NOT bg-brand-bg-fill)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with secondary/outline style
examples: Full outline button: border-brand-stroke-weak text-brand-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brand-secondary-hover
brandcolor-secondaryhover.logic: When a button is secondary (outline style with border), the hover should use bg-brand-secondary-hover (#292929), NOT bg-brand-bg-fill. This is a darker gray specifically for secondary button hovers.

brandcolor-textstrong.usage: Headings, main headings, button text in some cases

brandcolor-textweak.usage: Secondary text, secondary hierarchy after main text

brandcolor-strokestrong.usage: ALWAYS use for: Sidebar borders, input field borders, button borders, icons
brandcolor-strokestrong.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokestrong for sidebar borders, input field borders, and button borders. This is a mandatory rule.

brandcolor-strokeweak.usage: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, and all other light elements
whenToUse: Secondary button borders (ALL secondary buttons use this border color - exception to button border rule)
brandcolor-strokeweak.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokeweak for card borders and dividers. Secondary buttons are an exception and also use strokeweak, but all other button borders use strokestrong.

brandcolor-fill.usage: Layout background (NOT for secondary button hover - use brandcolor-secondaryhover instead)
brandcolor-fill.importantNote: DO NOT use this for secondary button hover - use brandcolor-secondaryhover (#292929) instead

brandcolor-white.usage: Background color in general wherever necessary

cornerRadius.description: ALL buttons (primary and secondary) MUST have 6px corner radius. Use rounded-md utility class.

secondaryBorderWidth.description: ALL secondary buttons (both types) MUST have 1.5px border width. Use border-[1.5px] utility class.

primary.description: Main CTA button with primary brand color
primary.logic: Uses primary brand color as background with white text. On hover, background changes to brand-hover which is a darker shade of primary for better visual feedback. ALWAYS includes rounded-md (6px corner radius).

secondary.description: Secondary button WITH brand secondary color (Type 1)
secondary.classes: border-[1.5px] border-brand-stroke-weak text-brand-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brand-secondary-hover rounded-md
secondary.logic: Transparent background with brand-stroke-weak border at 1.5px width and brand-secondary text. On hover, background fills with brand-secondary-hover. IMPORTANT: Border is ALWAYS brand-stroke-weak at 1.5px width, NOT brand-secondary. ALWAYS includes rounded-md (6px corner radius).
secondary.whenToUse: Use when you want the button to have the secondary brand color as text

secondary-outline.description: Secondary button WITHOUT brand secondary color (Type 2)
secondary-outline.classes: border-[1.5px] border-brand-stroke-weak text-brand-text-strong bg-transparent hover:bg-brand-secondary-hover rounded-md
secondary-outline.logic: Transparent background with brand-stroke-weak border at 1.5px width and brand-text-strong text. On hover, background fills with brand-secondary-hover. IMPORTANT: Border is ALWAYS brand-stroke-weak at 1.5px width, text is strong text color. ALWAYS includes rounded-md (6px corner radius).
secondary-outline.whenToUse: Use when you want a secondary button style but with strong text color instead of secondary brand color

criticalRules: ALL buttons MUST have rounded-md (6px corner radius) - NO EXCEPTIONS
ALL secondary buttons (both types) MUST have border-[1.5px] (1.5px border width) - NO EXCEPTIONS
Primary buttons do NOT have borders, only secondary buttons have borders
Never use rounded-lg, rounded-xl, or any other border radius for buttons - ALWAYS use rounded-md
Never use border, border-2, or any other border width for secondary buttons - ALWAYS use border-[1.5px]

input.description: Input fields with proper borders - MUST override browser defaults
input.logic: Strong stroke border by default, changes to text-strong color on focus. No extra border/ring on focus. Text color is always text-strong. CRITICAL: Must use focus:ring-0 to prevent default ring styles. Must use focus:outline-none to prevent browser default outline.
criticalRules: ALWAYS include focus:ring-0 to override default focus ring
ALWAYS include focus:outline-none to override browser default outline
NEVER allow browser default focus styles
Focus border MUST be brand-text-strong, NEVER brand-secondary or any other color
No box-shadow on focus - use focus:ring-0

h1.logic: Strong text color for main headings

h2.logic: Strong text color for secondary headings

h3.logic: Strong text color for tertiary headings

icon.logic: Icons should use strong stroke color for visibility

card.description: Card borders always use weak stroke
card.logic: Card borders MUST use strokeweak for subtle, light appearance

sidebar.description: Sidebar borders always use strong stroke
sidebar.logic: Sidebar borders MUST use strokestrong for visibility and definition

workflow: 1. BEFORE creating ANY component or making ANY styling changes, ALWAYS read this theme-guide.json file first
2. Check componentGuidelines section for specific component rules (buttons, inputs, headings, etc.)
3. Verify button specifications: rounded-md (6px) for all buttons, border-[1.5px] for secondary buttons
4. When creating components, follow the guidelines in componentGuidelines
5. Always use theme colors from globals.css, never hardcode hex values
6. Follow the logic explained in each component guideline
7. Combine utility classes as shown in examples

noHexCodes.rule: NEVER use hex color codes (#F84416, #0A0A0A, etc.) directly in HTML, CSS, or inline styles
noHexCodes.reason: All colors must come from theme utility classes for consistency and maintainability

noInlineStyles.rule: NEVER use inline styles (style='color: #F84416') or style attributes for colors
noInlineStyles.reason: All styling must use Tailwind utility classes from the theme system

onlyUtilityClasses.rule: ONLY use utility classes from theme-guide.json and globals.css
onlyUtilityClasses.reason: This ensures consistency, maintainability, and easy theme updates

rules: CRITICAL: NEVER hardcode hex colors (#F84416, #0A0A0A, etc.) - ALWAYS use Tailwind utility classes
CRITICAL: NEVER use inline styles (style='...') for colors - ALWAYS use utility classes
ONLY use utility classes from theme-guide.json and globals.css
Secondary buttons: border-[1.5px] border-brand-stroke-weak + text-brand-secondary + hover:bg-brand-secondary-hover
Input field borders: ALWAYS use border-brand-stroke-strong
